body:
@jjkoshy We have a reactive API on top of the Java producer/consumer. The API adds additional metadata to producer record (to track the record later in the flow) and record metadata (to match the result to the record that was sent - this is the metadata that was added to the producer record). We extend consumer record as well to be able to track and commit the record later in the flow. At the moment, all three are done using delegation since the classes were final. It would be nice to be able to subclass instead, especially since the other two were changed to non-final. At the moment, there is only one non-final class in o.a.k.c.producer/o.a.k.c.consumer and that is `RecordMetadata`. While it made sense to keep all classes final in the API, there seems to be less value in keeping just this one class final.

Having said that, there is nothing wrong with delegation and I wasn't considering submitting a PR until I saw the change to the other two. So I wouldn't be too concerned if this was not committed. If the change is not in 0.10.2.0, we are unlikely to use it anyway.
Ok, that seems to be in a different PR: https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/2379. Got it, thanks.

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed):

Test FAILed (JDK 8 and Scala 2.12).

Thanks @apurvam.
I see two tests of streams are failing but they are not likely related to this change, and I see these two tests are failing in different execution as well so I think we can ignore them.

Also the benchmark test has always ran nightly, that needs to be part of tests to be run (as @mjsax has already done, thanks)
@guozhangwang in an ideal world, this PR and PR: https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/2391/files should go together.
+1 on having separate PRs, ideally.
